responsibilities: Drive quality engineering for software products.
Build quality frameworks and develop test automation and tools.
Lead quality engineering and testing for a portfolio of corporate systems products.
Define and drive test approaches and test plans for assigned projects and functional test areas.
Expand current test cases and execute required tests.
Own quality for functional or application areas.
Define qualification strategies and execute functional and nonfunctional testing.
Coordinate testing efforts for complex client and server feature sets.
Partner with development and other teams to plan and deliver quality software.
qualifications: Strong technical background with hands-on experience in software QA/QE.
Experience in building test automation frameworks and business use-case testing.
Proficiency in Java and scripting languages (Perl, PHP, Python, etc).
Experience with Linux platforms and relational databases.
Proven bug detection and regression skills.
Experience testing on MacOS, iOS (mobile apps), and cloud-based technologies.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Experience with AI/ML in quality engineering, using tools like Selenium with ML add-ons.
Familiarity with machine learning libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Strong understanding of the ServiceNow platform, including modules like ITSM, ITOM, and custom workflows.
analysis: The job responsibilities focus on quality engineering for software products, including building quality frameworks, developing test automation, and leading testing efforts. The skills required include a strong technical background in software QA/QE, proficiency in programming and scripting languages, and experience with AI/ML in quality engineering. While there is mention of AI/ML, it is in the context of using tools like Selenium with ML add-ons and familiarity with machine learning libraries such as TensorFlow and PyTorch. There is no specific mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is more on general AI/ML applications in quality engineering rather than on GenAI or LLMs.
